thread.section_title: Things are still looking up for Top Gear as latest episode hailed ‘the best one yet’ – Metro
thread.title: Things are still looking up for Top Gear as latest episode hailed ‘the best one yet’
thread.title_full: Things are still looking up for Top Gear as latest episode hailed ‘the best one yet’

author: Sarah Deen
title: Things are still looking up for Top Gear as latest episode hailed ‘the best one yet’
text:
Chris Harris, Matt LeBlanc and Rory Reid are still a hit (Picture: BBC) Top Gear fans are loving the new series.
Mo Adeniran is the favourite to win The Voice UK Viewers tuned into another post-Chris Evans episode with Matt LeBlanc and Chris Harris.
The fourth episode of the new series (the 24th, but who’s counting?) saw the boys take part in a race across the Arabian peninsula, as you do.
Elsewhere co-host Rory Reid created a life-size arcade came to put city cars through their paces, and British rapper Tinie Tempah stopped by to have a crack at the Top Gear track in a Toyota GT86.
When the second series of the TG reboot launched viewers were loving the new team, and didn’t even miss oldheads Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May.
Matt and Chris have a lavish race at Dubai Marina (Picture: BBC) And from the reaction on social media, Matt, Chris and Rory should probably thinking about sticking around for a third run.
Fans praised the latest episode as ‘solid’ and ‘the best episode yet’, with some going as far as declaring it ‘better than The Grand Tour’.
One wrote on Twitter: ‘Seriously tho, new old Top Gear is crushing it…it’s a car show again!’
Tinie Tempah went for a spin (Picture: BBC) Another posted: ‘Top Gear is great back to real motor journalism, with a bit of fun.’
‘Is it wrong that I’m loving the new Top Gear and think it’s way better than the Grand Tour?’ another tweeted.
And the praise kept coming…
Seriously though, this series of #TopGear is the most enjoyable in a good while
— 
N Ireland YIMBY (@LibertyPaulM) March 26, 2017 @Matt_LeBlanc definitely gelling, great show #TopGear :)
— Christopher Tauers (@ChrisTauers) March 26, 2017 
Srsly tho, new old #TopGear is crushing it. @Matt_LeBlanc @harrismonkey @MrRoryReid so enjoyable to watch. it's a car show again! #rejoice 
— sarah (@sarahlancs) March 26, 2017 
Never watched the new #TopGear but based purely on how atrocious The Grand Tour is, I'd happily say the new Top Gear is much, much better.
— James McCrory (@Jamezmcc) March 26, 2017 
Is it wrong that I'm loving the new #TopGear and think it's way better then the #GrandTour ? @Matt_LeBlanc @harrismonkey @MrRoryReid good job
— Lisa Boam (@lisajb78) March 26, 2017 
Feel like I'm saying it every week but I'm really enjoying #TopGear this series. Best it's been for a few years (including the C/H/M years)
— Brad (@BradleyMell) March 26, 2017 
#TopGear Just went up a gear! Ride on!
— W.M.ASLAM (writer) (@WMASLAM63323693) March 26, 2017 
#TopGear is great back to real motor journalism, with a bit of fun 
— And Rew (@jol_rew) March 26, 2017 
#TopGear . Best episode yet! Love it
— Anas Mister (@m15ter) March 26, 2017 

Top Gear airs Sundays at 8pm on BBC One.
